segments.pli: “Sattahi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato sāriputto catasso paṭisambhidā sayaṃ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharati.
segments.en: “Mendicants, having seven qualities, Sāriputta realized the four kinds of textual analysis and lives having achieved them with his own insight.

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, sāriputto ‘idaṃ me cetaso līnattan’ti yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti;
segments.en: It’s when Sāriputta truly understood: ‘This is mental sluggishness’.

segments.pli: ajjhattaṃ saṅkhittaṃ vā cittaṃ ‘ajjhattaṃ me saṅkhittaṃ cittan’ti yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti;
segments.en: He truly understood internally constricted mind as ‘internally constricted mind’.

segments.pli: bahiddhā vikkhittaṃ vā cittaṃ ‘bahiddhā me vikkhittaṃ cittan’ti yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti;
segments.en: He truly understood externally scattered mind as ‘externally scattered mind’.

segments.pli: tassa viditā vedanā uppajjanti, viditā upaṭṭhahanti, viditā abbhatthaṃ gacchanti;
segments.en: He knew feelings, perceptions, and thoughts as they arose, as they remained, and as they went away.

segments.pli: vitakkā uppajjanti, viditā upaṭṭhahanti, viditā abbhatthaṃ gacchanti;
sappāyāsappāyesu kho panassa dhammesu hīnappaṇītesu kaṇhasukkasappaṭibhāgesu nimittaṃ suggahitaṃ sumanasikataṃ sūpadhāritaṃ suppaṭividdhaṃ paññāya.
segments.en: The patterns of qualities—suitable or unsuitable, inferior or superior, or those on the side of dark or bright—were properly grasped, attended, borne in mind, and comprehended with wisdom.

segments.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, sattahi dhammehi samannāgato sāriputto catasso paṭisambhidā sayaṃ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharatī”ti.
segments.en: Having these seven qualities, Sāriputta realized the four kinds of textual analysis and lives having achieved them with his own insight.”
